elements.desc:
Element for generating a Google Maps Street View Panorama.

##### Example

    <google-streetview-pano
      pano-id="CWskcsTEZBNXaD8gG-zATA"
      heading="330"
      pitch="-2"
      zoom="0.8"
      disable-default-ui>
    </google-streetview-pano>

There are tons of great panoramas on the [Google Maps | Views page](https://www.google.com/maps/views/home?gl=us)

To grab a panorama, look at its url in the address bar. For example:

google.com/maps/views/view/102684927602131521305/photo/**1szTnskrdKIAAAGuu3fZRw**

The hash in bold is the `pano-id`. You'll often need to dial in the `heading`, `pitch` and `zoom` manually.

properties.name: apiKey
properties.desc: A Maps API key. To obtain an API key, see developers.google.com/maps/documentation/javascript/tutorial#api_key.

properties.name: clientId
properties.desc:
A Maps API for Business Client ID. To obtain a Maps API for Business Client ID, see developers.google.com/maps/documentation/business/.
If set, a Client ID will take precedence over an API Key.

properties.name: disableAutoPan
properties.desc: If true, disables the auto panning animation

properties.name: disableDefaultUi
properties.desc: If true, disables all default UI.

properties.name: heading
properties.desc: The camera heading in degrees relative to true north. True north is 0°, east is 90°, south is 180°, west is 270°.

properties.name: language
properties.desc:
The localized language to load the Maps API with. For more information
see https://developers.google.com/maps/documentation/javascript/basics#Language

Note: the Maps API defaults to the preferred language setting of the browser.
Use this parameter to override that behavior.

properties.name: libraries
properties.desc:
A comma separated list (e.g. "places,geometry") of libraries to load
with this map. Defaults to "places". For more information see
https://developers.google.com/maps/documentation/javascript/libraries.

properties.name: panoId
properties.desc:
Specifies which photosphere to load

**Required**

properties.name: pitch
properties.desc: The camera pitch in degrees, relative to the street view vehicle. Ranges from 90° (directly upwards) to -90° (directly downwards).

properties.name: reset
properties.desc: Reset the pov for the panorama.

properties.name: stop
properties.desc: Cancel the slow panning animation.

properties.name: update
properties.desc:
Fired every rAF. Updates the heading to create a slow pan effect
Will be canceled by mouse enter or calling stop()

properties.name: version
properties.desc: Version of the Google Maps API to use.

properties.name: zoom
properties.desc: Sets the zoom level of the panorama. Fully zoomed-out is level 0, where the field of view is 180 degrees.

properties.name: _getPanoOptions
properties.desc: Returns the an object with the current panorama configurations.
